posts.post_content:
I'll sell you a finger. :eek:

[IMG]https://www.collectorfocus.com/images/show/frankbmd/t206-sgc/10272/mcgraw-finger[/IMG]

A respectable John McGraw (P150) with the elevated digit in an SGC 30 holder is offered for sale at $79.

Not only do you get the finger in the air with this purchase, I'm going to throw in the other nine fingers as well.  That's less than $8 a finger.

Don West wouldn't ship this for free, but I will.

$79 net to me is all that you need.  PP F&F preferred, but if you want to pay with chickens or eggs, let's talk.;)

If you want to pay more, bid on Probstein's finger.
Don West lol, that guy could wake me up from a dead sleep.
We can only be sure of 5 Fingers......:D
I'm probably the only farmer on the board. I actually have chickens and their eggs .Going rate for organic free range eggs here is $8/dozen.   I'll trade you eight dozen but you have to pick up.

[quote name="Tao_Moko" post=1673245]I'm probably the only farmer on the board. I actually have chickens and their eggs .Going rate for organic free range eggs here is $8/dozen.   I'll trade you eight dozen but you have to pick up.[/QUOTE]

WOW I wish we could get those prices here($4 dozen). I was a farmer till last fall when I hung it up. Just could not compete with the cheap crap sold in the stores. People would rather pay $.79Lb for a rock hard flavor less tomato than $2.50Lb of a nice one with flavor. I could not grow stuff for the prices WalMart sells their garbage for.:(

I don't have any chickens or eggs but I do have a lot of used greenhouse equipment I could trade.:)

[quote name="Tao_Moko" post=1673245]I'm probably the only farmer on the board. I actually have chickens and their eggs .Going rate for organic free range eggs here is $8/dozen.   I'll trade you eight dozen but you have to pick up.[/QUOTE]

You can just bring the eggs when you pick up the card.;)

[quote name="bnorth" post=1673253]WOW I wish we could get those prices here($4 dozen). I was a farmer till last fall when I hung it up. Just could not compete with the cheap crap sold in the stores. People would rather pay $.79Lb for a rock hard flavor less tomato than $2.50Lb of a nice one with flavor. I could not grow stuff for the prices WalMart sells their garbage for.:(

I don't have any chickens or eggs but I do have a lot of used greenhouse equipment I could trade.:)[/QUOTE]

Sorry to hear it Ben. I've heard the same thing many times here in California.   :(

I'm going to go out o limb and guess that a thread selling McGraw's Finger card has never before been hijacked by a discussion of the regional pricing of eggs.  Correct me if I'm wrong.

Just to get this back on track, today I will flip the finger for $74 shipped.

Frank, 

     You sold somebody the finger. :eek:

[quote name="Brian Van Horn" post=1673509]Frank, 

     You sold somebody the finger. :eek:[/QUOTE]

Well yeah, he couldn't just give him the finger.   :p
